intro: Neubeckia verna, commonly known as the early yellow violet, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom early in the spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and has heart-shaped, hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Neubeckia verna is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting early pollinators.
